architectural_notes: Add a hard cache-bust + forced rebuild step to ensure production serves the latest frontend assets (e.g., assignments.ts) after deploys.
known_issues: Production/live build may serve cached/older frontend assets, causing invalid/old assignment IDs (e.g., "awareness") to be sent and rejected by the canister.

existing_features.title: Harden the appâ€™s forced-refresh mechanism so that when a version mismatch is detected, the app performs a one-time hard refresh that bypasses caches as aggressively as possible and avoids refresh loops.

When a recording upload fails with a backend error indicating an invalid assignment (e.g., "Invalid assignment: \"awareness\""), show a clear English user-facing recovery message and provide an in-app action to perform a hard refresh (cache-busted reload).

Add lightweight diagnostics to help confirm stale-asset situations in production by logging the running app version and the latest fetched app version when a mismatch is detected, and logging the running app version when an invalid-assignment upload error occurs (no sensitive data).

new_feature_requests.summary: Ensure every production build deploys a unique, non-placeholder app version identifier and that the running app can reliably read it at runtime (used for update detection and cache-busting).

projectName: Fix production stale-asset caching causing invalid assignment errors (hard cache-bust + forced refresh)
